de.awi.floenavigation.services

Class PredictionService

  • java.lang.Object
    • android.content.Context
      • android.content.ContextWrapper
        • android.app.Service
          • android.app.IntentService
            • de.awi.floenavigation.services.PredictionService
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    android.content.ComponentCallbacks, android.content.ComponentCallbacks2

    public class PredictionService
extends android.app.IntentService
    An IntentService subclass for handling asynchronous task requests in a service on a separate handler thread.

    PredictionService service is used to predict the future positions of all the fixed stations at a specified time interval Since the AIS packets are received every 3 minutes, it is desirable and necessary to predict the positions of the stations between these intervals at a higher rate, which helps the grid to show and monitor the fixed stations in a continuous manner.

    Also ValidationService service takes use of the predicted positions by comparing it with received values to verify sea ice break scenario

    TODO: Customize class - update intent actions, extra parameters and static helper methods.

    • Method Detail

      • onCreate

        public void onCreate()
        Overrides:
        onCreate in class android.app.IntentService

      • onHandleIntent

        protected void onHandleIntent(android.content.Intent intent)
        This method is invoked on the worker thread Runnable is initialized to run every PREDICTION_TIME msecs Fixed stations are retrieved from the local database and new positions are calculated using NavigationFunctions.calculateNewPosition(double, double, double, double). If the origin and the x-axis fixed station are already broken off, instead of taking the received latitude and longitude values, previous predicted values are taken to predict the future positions. After the new positions are predicted the updated values are stored back to the corresponding columns of the fixed station table DatabaseHelper.fixedStationTable in the local database. if stopRunnable is true, the runnable is stopped until setStopRunnable(boolean) with false value is not received from SyncActivity.stopServices() and SetupActivity.runServices(android.content.Context)
        Specified by:
        onHandleIntent in class android.app.IntentService
        Parameters:
        intent - Intent
